page.title: 14The Church Page 1
page.content:
The church in Compton serves the parish of: Compton_Combe_tun meaning "village in the valley." Shawford_Schald meaning "shallow ford." Silkstead_the stedings or farm buildings of one Selc.
The church porch is victorian.Above the door is a beutifully carved arch. This door is large,firm and has iron studs on it. In 1905 so many people used the church that they decided to add an extension.Some large pillars mark where the south wall of the old church used to be.In the western part of the old church is a font.Next to the font are three new bell ropes they were installed by Charles Cope.The bells are rung by two boys from Compton
